name: NHSNContraindicationType
title: NHSNContraindicationType
purpose: (Clinical Focus: NHSN surveillance reporting: Contraindication for using chlorhexidine gluconate (CHG) for Central Line Insertion Practices (CLIP) adherence monitoring),(Data Element Scope: A coded observation value representing the type of contraindication.),(Inclusion Criteria: ),(Exclusion Criteria: )

concept.display: Patient is less than 2 months of age - chlorhexidine gluconate is to be used with caution in patients less than 2 months of age
Patient has a documented/known allergy/reaction to chlorhexidine gluconate-based products that would preclude its use
Facility restrictions or safety concerns for chlorhexidine gluconate use in premature infants precludes its use

contains.display: Patient is less than 2 months of age - chlorhexidine gluconate is to be used with caution in patients less than 2 months of age
Patient has a documented/known allergy/reaction to chlorhexidine gluconate-based products that would preclude its use
